boardgame.name: 100 Random Weapon Descriptions - Volume 062
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ever been in a dungeon and needed some items to give it that extra pop? Have your players gotten used to all the special weapons available in the core rulebooks? Never fear. Within this collection are 100 different weapon names. Some good, some evil, some indifferent. Whether catering to players who love to collect rare items, or just looking to add some extra zing to a random treasure table; this collection of weapon names is categorized as a quick table capable of handling either situation.

How to Use This Book

Grab a set of percentile dice (d100) and roll to determine what the random weapon is that your player may have just stumbled upon. Players should show caution as these weapons are very descriptive yet still leave an open end for their game master to add their own choice of abilities to the back end. Partner this table with one of our random room tables to generate a fully in-depth treasure location. Gather your players, roll some dice, and Adventure On!

boardgame.name: Uglydolls: Adventures in Uglyville
boardgame.description:
Inspired by Uglydoll themes of adventure and acceptance. Players can imagine Uglydoll adventures as they move around the game board collecting cardboard goodies at the locations based on those in the movie. They can collect a teacup from lucky bat's tea house, or a heart from moxy's news stand, doggie sunglasses from Ugly dog's pet Shop, and more. Then it's a race to reach the Portal to the big world! The First player to land on the Portal space with a full pocket wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.description: Custom dice cup offered in Rome & Roll Kickstarter campaign

boardgame.name: Blades & Magic
Blades and Magic
boardgame.description:
Blades & Magic is a 3D RPG for mobile phones. Players take the role of Bryn, a young warrior of the Grimblade Clan whose parents were slaughtered by an evil orc and he goes on a quest to avenge their deaths and stop their leader, Balrazhul, from taking over the land.

The game is divided into 9 chapters and most of the gameplay occurs on a map. Players travel to different areas through the map and are attacked by enemies during their travels. With each step that players take, they are given a choice of examining their surroundings, visiting merchants and taverns in cities or continuing the chapter by visiting places they have to be in according to the main quest. Players may also accept side-quests to gain money and accessories that will aid them in battle.

The combat switches to a 3D mode and is turn-based with players being able to assign up to 5 consecutive actions. Players can purchase and use different kinds of weapons, as well as magic spells in combat.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2007 German Developer Award Best German Mobile/Handheld Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Akmei's Spellbook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Imagination and skill have gotten me through many tough spots. Anvils and luck took care of the rest.
- Mortimer Akmei

Akmei's Spellbook is a set wizard spells and artifacts for 5e based on common gags from classic cartoons. If you have every wished your mage could summon anvils from thin air to crush their enemies or make an escape through a hastily painted tunnel then this is the spellbook you've been waiting for.

This zine features:

A short background on the mage Mortimer Akmei and his finding the plane of Illust
10 original spells ranging from cantrips to level 5
5 cartoon inspired artifacts

boardgame.name: Terror in the Berkshires
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This adventure is based on actual cryptid encounters and legends.

When a group of travellers breakdown along the Mohawk Trail on their way to North Adams, MA, they find themselves facing a series of events and creatures from local folklore. From the famous Hairpin Turn to the Hoosac Tunnel—nicknamed The Bloody Pit during it's construction—the players can follow the clues to unravel the truth about what is happening in this scenic landscape.

This adventure features:

Background information for establishing an immersive adventure
System agnostic encounters that can easily be adapted to your favorite RPG
A flexible story arc providing the players multiple options and ways to resolve the case.

boardgame.name: The Beast of Bray Road
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This adventure is based on actual cryptid encounters and legends.

In 1936, a large, bipedal creature was sighted along Bray Road in Elkhorn, WI. The report stated that it stood 6-7 feet tall and had distinctive canine features much like a wolf walking on its hind legs. Since that initial encounter, numerous other sightings have occured in the surrounding area.

Investigations to date have turned up little evidence supporting the existence of this cryptid, but has uncovered a longer history of sightings in local folk lore and Native American tales. It seems "dogmen" have prowled the woods of Wisconsin for centuries. Reports of the creature cluster together both geographically and chronologically.

Three days ago, Dr. Aveline Schneider was involved in an accident near her home on Bray Rd. The report states that she collided with a large animal. The creature was not found but blood an hair samples were taken from her vehicle. Lab reports indicate that the samples appear canine but of no known species.

Your team is being sent to investigate this case. Your orders are to gather all available evidence, track and capture the beast if possible, and kill it if necessary.

This adventure features:

Background information for establishing an immersive adventure
System agnostic encounters that can easily be adapted to your favorite RPG
A flexible story arc providing the players multiple options and ways to resolve the case.
A map of Elkhorn, WI and the surrounding area

boardgame.name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game Dark Revelations Novella with Gloria Goldberg Promo Cards
Arkham Horror: The Card Game Gloria Goldberg Promo Cards
boardgame.description: This is a set of four promo cards for Arkham Horror: The Card Game, featuring a new investigator—the writer, Gloria Goldberg. They were included with copies of the novella Dark Revelations.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Arkham Horror TCG Books & Replacement Cards
Game: Arkham Horror The Card Game
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Cards + book

boardgame.name: OmissssimO
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

OmissíssimO is an investigative / thriller RPG, set in the country called Lisarb, a place doomed by its organizations full of dark secrets and hellish events that most citizens choose to ignore, many for fear of accepting reality and others for being part of it.

The main characters of this story are no different, they all have dark pasts linked to institutions as bizarre as the country itself. It's up to you as a player to decide the future of this character. Should them break free and build their own path, or should they simply accept the blessing of ignorance?

It was written to be a simple RPG that can be quickly learned and played. Many commonly
known mechanisms from PbtA games here have been simplified and summarized to better focus on a narrative driven, easy and quick experience, like:

Only 5 Basic Moves
Only 4 Initial Playbooks.
Every Playbook is made so it can fit in a single page.(

boardgame.name: Beggar's Banquet
boardgame.description:
Most people in Medieval Europe suffered in abject poverty, many driven to begging in the streets, their survival at the mercy of the passing nobility. In this game, players take on the role of lowly beggars, visiting village sites in search of sustenance and working the passing nobility for largess. Players can chose to exploit their own infirmities, or visit the cathedral in hopes of a miracle. During this struggle for survival, beggars must also avoid the stern eye of the village constable patrolling the streets. The winner is the player who can acquire the most alms to survive in the harsh world for another day.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Bonnets, Bustles, and Boots
boardgame.description:
In the late 19th century, families and friends would gather in their parlors to play games. It was an aspect of their social life and a stage for the strict etiquette of the day. This three-handed card game would have been perfect for the Victorian courting sensibilities, played by a young couple and their chaperone. By playing your cards carefully you will gain cards that will contribute to your final score. However, you can decide to use a scoring card to win a different (and perhaps better) card. A very light, unique game for three that can be played almost anywhere by anyone, depicting the latest fashions of the 1880s. Remember the "good old days."

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Shred Magazine (Volume 1, Issue 3 - May 2000)
boardgame.description:
Shred Magazine
Volume 1, Issue 3
May 2000

boardgame.name: Quests & Cannons: The Risen Islands
boardgame.description:
A high fantasy on the high seas competitive, sandbox-style adventure game for 1-6 players.

Quests & Cannons: The Risen Islands takes place in the original fantasy world of Miraheim, where a set of mysterious islands have risen from the sea. With the delicate balance of the world disrupted, the people of Miraheim begin to leave their homelands and to settle on the islands, finding them to be plentiful in resources. Ancient writings have begun to be uncovered telling of a mythical artifact hidden among the islands through a series of map clues that could be the key to restoring balance to the world. Players are adventurers sent from one of the three prominent kingdoms of Miraheim to ensure the prosperity of their kingdom's settlers as well as search for this fabled treasure that could save their homes.

Quests & Cannons: The Risen Islands is an accessible, deep strategy game about exploration, epic quests, and exciting combat. Players use action points each turn on an open movement, modular game board to explore the various islands, receive quests from the settlers, gather resources, find map clues, upgrade their ships, collect loot, and trade cannon fire with rival adventurers. The object of the game is to get to the most prosperity at the end of the game. Players earn prosperity by finishing quests, completing map clues, and attacking other players.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Superlatives
Superlatives Core Rulebook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the pages of comic books and the screens of our televisions super heroes leap out into our collective consciousness. These men and women possess remarkable capabilities and dwell in amazing worlds where you never know if a radioactive meteor shall fall from the sky, mole men erupt from the ground, demons invade from other dimensions, or giant crabs stalk in from the sea. Over the decades these characters have met, fought, befriended and fought again, to form vast webs of frequently retconned stories spun over fantastical but ever familiar worlds.

Superlatives lets you adventure in such a comic book world, spinning your characters’ own tales and powers through Superlatives' unique system of continuous character creation.

This core rulebook includes the complete rules of Superlatives alongside a rogues gallery of heroes, villains and supporting cast to help and hinder your heroes.

boardgame.name: Ultra Base
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ultra Base is a highly advanced missile base and research centre in the heart of a timeless cold war.

Constantly besieged by spies, human and alien alike, this installation sits in the centre of webs of global intrigue.

This book is the first official setting for Superlatives and features:

Descriptions of the eponymous military base, the despotic nations of Falkestan and Mycella, the global conspiracy THRONE, three alien cultures, the antimatter universe and a grim alternate future.
Sixty new characters
The adventure THRONE Island

boardgame.name: Odlican
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oldican is a land of adventure and intrigue ruled by ancient houses of aristocratic mutants and lodges of magicians. Only recently has their power been challenged- by upstart superhumans wielding technological and "scientific" powers.

Odlican is an official setting for Superlatives and includes:

A full description of the land of Odlican, its history and regions.
Descriptions of the mutant families and magical lineages that make up the aristocracy of Odlican.
Thirty five new characters: aristocratic and otherwise.
The adventure Eyebeam Wedding to introduce players to this land's turbulent politics.

boardgame.name: Avalon Academy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Avalon Academy is a school for superhumans located on a mystical island of magicians and fey magic presided over by headmaster Merlin. Beyond its magical defences the world reels in the aftermath of a devasatating alien invasion which cut down the previous generation of heroes.

This book is the third official setting for Superlatives and features:

Descriptions of the eponymous school, and the invading Aquarians.
Sixty seven new characters: including staff and pupils from Avalon Academy, Japan's Kazuki Takahashi High, and the Franco-Dutch Lycées De Abbatage - in addition to the Aquarians' deadly servitors.
The adventure Inter-School competition which pits the three schools against each others, an ancient villain from the days of Arthur and alien menaces.

boardgame.name: The City
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The City is a sinister dictatorship presided over by the mysterious dictator Supreme. The heroes of the City must not only struggle against the machinery of state but the horrors of the City's (heavily classified) past- including the alien Cascade, monsterous Gods of Darkness and innumerable other secrets.

The City is an offical setting for Superlatives and includes:

A description of this city state, its districts, government and official history.
Details of resistance movements, the alien Cascade and forces of dark magic which menace the citizens of The City.


Seventy new characters.

The adventure Diamond in the Rought - pitting characters against the arbitary decisions of Supreme's government and offering a glimpse beyond the Ministry of Information's lies.

boardgame.name: Nightworld
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As the sun mysteriously vanishes heroes scramble to deal the the ongoing apocalypse and the multitude of mythological powers that now walk the Earth.

Nightworld is an official setting for Superlatives and features:

A full description of the City of Freebrook and its immediate environs.
A description of Norse and Egyptian myth though a superhero lens.
Sixty five new characters.
The adventure Prisoners of Winter where the characters investigate the strange disappearance of the Sun.

boardgame.name: Epoch City
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Epoch City struggles under the weight of corruption, violence and decay. A city without heroes, indeed without super powers. Until now...

Epoch City is an official setting for Superlatives and was a stretch goal for the Kickstarter campaign. It includes:

A full description of the eponomous city.
Eight new characters.
Two new adventures: Status Quo and Rise of Heroes, introducing superhumans to this city.

boardgame.name: Opportunity
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Opportunity is a city built, and torn down, by generations of superhumans divided into the warring clubs of the Vindicator Association of heroes and Dark Space of villains. Recently both groups, and the ordinary inhabitants of the city, have been forced to adapt to their dramatic new circumstances as war with a mysterious subterranean empire transported the city to a great sea of magma.

Opportunity is an official setting for Superlatives and was a stretch goal for the Kickstarter campaign. It includes:

A full description of the eponomous city and the factions which war over it.
Twenty two new characters.
The adventure The Mions Return which pits characters against these mysterious creatures.

boardgame.name: The Vomit Vault of Vechuga (S&W)
boardgame.description:
VECHUGA IS DEAD!

LONG LIVE VECHUGA!

A demon sitting in a fetid steam room, pools of yellow bile and mushroom men: this short adventure is a gooey filler dungoen that can be explored in a single session.

Fighting is optional, and the lonely skeleton caked in puke may just be waiting for company in his deadly sauna. Killing it triggers a "monster trap" harking back to DOOM I and II.

Endure the billowing yellow fog and attain the favor of Vechuga, the demon of bile himself!

boardgame.name: The Vomit Vault of Vechuga (Maze Rats)
boardgame.description:
VECHUGA IS DEAD!

LONG LIVE VECHUGA!

A demon sitting in a fetid steam room, pools of yellow bile and mushroom men: this short adventure is a gooey filler dungoen that can be explored in a single session.

Fighting is optional, and the lonely skeleton caked in puke may just be waiting for company in his deadly sauna. Killing it triggers a "monster trap" harking back to DOOM I and II.

Endure the billowing yellow fog and attain the favor of Vechuga, the demon of bile himself!

boardgame.name: Pylon Theft
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Aetherium RPG is a tabletop roleplaying game set in a cyberpunk future that offers easy to understand rules that focus on creativity and story. Pylon Theft is a one-shot scenario for the game. It includes 5 pregenerated characters that just need a couple of Programs added to them to finalize them.

In this adventure, the characters are set on a mission to take down a RezX Pylon, destabilizing part of a city so that House Ikaru can swoop in and take over.

boardgame.name: The Dark Well
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 519th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a possibly magical well in the forest covering a mountain's slopes.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Lookout Point
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 518th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a touristic lookout point along a road.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Lift Off! Get me off this Planet! Expanded Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
It’s been a fun existence, but someone tripped over a coolant cord in the core and the planet you’ve called home for eons is going to explode.

The objective of Lift Off! Get me off this Planet! is to be the first player to get their Aliens off the planet using resource cards, action cards‚ and phases of the moon.
- Lift Off! Get me off this Planet! is a fresh, lightweight take on unit placement and resource management. The cooperative-to-competitive dynamic and imminent doom creates strong tension and drama at the end of the game.
- It's an easy to learn, fast-paced game, where everyone feels engaged and "in it" until someone has won or the planet explodes!

The Expanded Deluxe Edition is the Original Game plus MUCH MORE
- Single Player mode with unique components
- Increased play count to 6
- New Exit Points
- New Lift Off Points
- The Gurglore
- A player Rocket Ships

-description from designer

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Spiked Pits
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 517th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a touristic lookout point along a road.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Nature Companions
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nature companions are often called animal companions, although are are also uncommon instances of plant and draconic companions, they all have an animalistic intelligence. Companions advance in stages, from young to mature to advanced to specialised.

The stat-blocks for all of the young, mature, advanced and specialised companion options are included, alongside the published uncommon types companions, and nine new types.

All stat-blocks have been reworked into the same format, offering much greater future flexibility.

boardgame.name: Artillery Shooting Range
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 516th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a touristic lookout point along a road.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Eldritch Paragon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Steeped from childhood in the art of spellcasting, you avidly listened the the tales of the heroes of old and the powerful magic they controlled. Some say that the days of magic are waining, that the technology of the press and gun is weakening the ancient arts. You pay no heed to these doomsayers, for you have found the path to become a paragon amost your eldritch peers.

Whilst not, for now, able to wield more powerful magics, you have found ways of increasing your daily sustainablity, mirroring those who follow multiple paths whilst keeping your powers within your chosen tradition.

The Eldritch Paragon is an architype for spellcasters that increases their number of daily slots, emulating the greater flexibility of 1st edition spell casters. Available from 4th level, with feats at every even level up to 20th.

boardgame.name: The King's Bath
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 515th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a touristic lookout point along a road.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Ancestral Paragon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Like your ancestors of old who had their whole life and profession defined by their parentage, you are a paragon of your people. Whilst you, like all adventurers, practice a core methodology, you have devoted much of your expertise to the ways of your forebearers and the mark they made upon the world.

The ancestral paragon archetype a development of the ‘Ancestry Paragon’ option discussed in the Gamemastery Guide. In addition to offering a range of new ancestry assisting feats, it adds the flexibility of allowing more Ancestry Feats, but as the cost of class feats, so remains balanced with other more traditional characters.

boardgame.name: Monumental Bridge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 514th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a touristic lookout point along a road.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Fuel Depot
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 513th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a touristic lookout point along a road.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Civilization Codex Lifepath: Backgrounds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Civilization Codex Lifepath focuses on building character stories for Pathfinder Second Edition, updating many of the 1st edition traits and backgrounds.

The first phase, backgrounds, is 128 pages and includes:

Nearly 300 backgrounds

24 origins
73 roles
70 professions
120 class backgrounds,


Over 400 feats

28 ancestry feats
90 background feats
76 background skill feats
191 narrative feats


Over 200 flaws

47 banes
120 curses
62 malignancies

boardgame.name: Flooded Dwarven Vaults
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bricks have fallen from their place in the walls as you traverse the broken corridors, statues ever watchful. You reach a room where it looks like a fountain once was but now only a stagnant pond remains. To it’s left is a room containing many bookshelves and two chests, but a portcullis bars your way.

Behind one of the statues, a crumbling tunnel leads to the sepulcher, marking the graves of long dead dwarven warriors. Stairs lead up from the sepulcher, through a basement storeroom full of old wines and ales, then into the main chamber.

The main chamber has been partially flooded after what looks like an earthquake brought down some of the walls, however some of the exits that lead to other vaults containing long lost goods and weapons still remain.

boardgame.name: Fiery Dwarven Vaults
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bricks have fallen from their place in the walls as you traverse the broken corridors, statues ever watchful. You reach a room where it looks like a fountain once was but now only a stagnant pond remains. To it’s left is a room containing many bookshelves and two chests, but a portcullis bars your way.

Behind one of the statues, a crumbling tunnel leads to the sepulcher, marking the graves of long dead dwarven warriors. Stairs lead up from the sepulcher, through a basement storeroom full of old wines and ales, then into the main chamber.

The main chamber has been partially flooded by magma after what looks like an earthquake brought down some of the walls, however some of the exits that lead to other vaults containing long lost goods and weapons still remain.

boardgame.name: Ruined Dwarven Vaults
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bricks have fallen from their place in the walls as you traverse the broken corridors, statues ever watchful. You reach a room where it looks like a fountain once was but now only a stagnant pond remains. To it’s left is a room containing many bookshelves and two chests, but a portcullis bars your way.

Behind one of the statues, a crumbling tunnel leads to the sepulcher, marking the graves of long dead dwarven warriors. Stairs lead up from the sepulcher, through a basement storeroom full of old wines and ales, then into the main chamber.

The main chamber holds several exits that lead to other vaults containing long lost goods or weapons, but once again you’re barred by iron bound doors.

boardgame.name: The Dread Engine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A dark hallway leads you into a large room where four colorful crystalline structures sit upon pedestals, power being drawn via specialized tubes to power this gigantic machine. Gears whirl and grind as switches are flipped, releasing colorful gases below the main platform of the machine.

The heart of the machine sits at the top of a set of stairs, strange alien ciphers carved into it’s base.

A large devilish stone head glares down at you, red crystallized gems protruding from it’s face.

boardgame.name: Powered Down Creation Forge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A dark hallway leads you into a large room where four pale crystalline structures sit upon pedestals, specialized tubes which were at one stage used to power this gigantic machine. Gears sit silent and waiting below the main platform.

The heart of the machine sits at the top of a set of stairs, strange alien ciphers carved into it’s base. It’s core sits idle just waiting be activated again.

boardgame.name: The Creation Forge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A dark hallway leads you into a large room where four colorful crystalline structures sit upon pedestals, power being drawn via specialized tubes to power this gigantic machine. Gears whirl and grind as switches are flipped, releasing colorful gases below the main platform of the machine.

The heart of the machine sits at the top of a set of stairs, strange alien ciphers carved into it’s base. A large hologram of the world spins slowly in it’s center as a grid system layered above attends to unknown activities.

boardgame.name: Cultivate
boardgame.description:
Plot, Draft and Plant. Make your garden thrive!
Cultivate is a spatial card-laying game for 1-4 players in which you will draft succulents, house plants, and cacti, then arrange them in your garden.

During the game, you’ll create your personal garden by laying and tucking cards, buying and placing trinkets, and covering all those pesky bugs. Score points by creating sets of plants with similar growing conditions and by carefully arranging your plot. The player whose garden thrives the most (earns the most points) wins!

This is the 2nd Game in the Quarks Series by XYZ Game Labs.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mad Construct's Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Four colorful crystalline structures sit upon pedestals, power being drawn via specialized tubes to power this gigantic machine. Gears whirl and grind as switches are flipped, releasing colorful gases below the main platform of the machine.

The heart of the machine sits at the top of a set of stairs, strange alien ciphers carved into it’s base. A large devilish stone head glares down at you, red crystallized gems protruding from it’s face.

boardgame.name: Powered Down Dream Engine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Four pale crystalline structures sit upon pedestals, specialized tubes which were at one stage used to power this gigantic machine. Gears sit silent and waiting below the main platform.

The heart of the machine sits at the top of a set of stairs, strange alien ciphers carved into it’s base. It’s core sits idle just waiting be activated again.

boardgame.name: The Gulzard Chronicles
World of Gulzard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Gulzard a world filed with prosper and adventure or harsh rulings and fierece leaders. Depending where you are born the land of Gulzard may be home or far from it.

A 200 year war oppresses the race of Orcs, Dwarves and Magic users ignore the world beyond there borders, the Capital rises as Orcs become outcasts.

Where will your adventures take you?

To the deep world beneath Gulzard fighting the wretched ShadowSpawn?

Perhaps you will face the peaks of kings and discover the truth of the Ie Giants!

Maybe you plan to confront the war head on and end the fighting once and for all?

What secrects do the Mages hide inside their sealed city?
The World of Gulzard is at your desposal!

Complete with a 2k, 4k and 8k World map! A family Tree dating back to the discovery of the land as well as a document on the politics and each city, ready for you to dive in and create your own campaign!

boardgame.name: Bait & Switch
boardgame.description:
Bait & Switch is a two-part social deduction game for 3-9 players. Each round players will have to decide which crew to join to pull off a heist. After the heist, they’ll either keep their alliances and split the loot, or try to double cross the crew and keep it all for themselves. Played over 5 rounds, the winner is the player closest to 25 points without going over.

Collude, Collect & Double Cross?
You’ve got a heist to pull! You’ll need some extraordinary individuals with a very specific set of skills to join your crew. But once the crew has finished the job, who gets the loot? Figure out who your real friends are to score big. And watch out, if you don’t spot the foe you could be left with nothing!

This is the third game in the XYZ Game Labs "Quarks" series.

boardgame.name: Apocalyptic 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a 5 map set of ruined towns, roads and other modern setting maps great for all of your end of the world needs. They vary from 22x17 to 44x34 and have night and day lighting scheme for each map.

boardgame.name: Fantasy 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a smattering of maps featuring a large 44x34 grave yard and a variety of other town maps gridded at 22x17. These are perfect for Vtts and as always I included maps with grids and with out.

boardgame.name: After Them!
boardgame.description:
System-agnostic Chase Rules to Augment Your Favorite Roleplaying Game

Publisher's blurb:

Chase scenes are fun and exciting! But not every tabletop RPG handles them well, and trying to shoehorn them in doesn't always work.

After Them! provides a concise, intuitive set of rules that you can attach to your game of choice to produce a fast-paced and engaging chase scene that's still faithful to the feel of whatever game you're playing.

This title includes:


Main rules PDF
Plain-text version for use with screen readers
Printable tracking sheet for visualizing positions

boardgame.name: Holy Book Names
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Give a name to the book of holy words

Holy Books are found in almost every religion. They give the followers of that religion text that help explain the creation of the world, their place in it and rules to live by. Sometimes these names can be descriptive of the contents or be metaphorical.

This Quick Generator can be used to give you a name for various holy books or a chapter/section within it. Designed for use in the fantasy genre, this can be used in modern and sci-fi setting for religions that have lasted until the current period, or for referring to holy texts of times gone past.

Featuring 2 x d100 tables that can give you 10,000 possible combinations

Example outputs:


The Anthem of the Epoch
The Matriarch Codex
The Sacrament of the Guardian
The Litany of Peace
The Archangel Aria

boardgame.name: Cocktails
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What you drinking tonight?

Drinks are, for many, but not all people, something to help them relax. Cocktails are one such beverage. A cocktail is often defined as an alcoholic drink consisting of a spirit or spirits mixed with other ingredients.

Not all of these are alcoholic either because some people, for various reasons will not or cannot consume alcoholic beverages.

Some may be innocent-sounding and hit like a brick when consumed, and others are the opposite and sound extremely dangerous but have zero % alcohol.

This PDF gives you a way of coming up with a recipe for a cocktail, using real-world ingredients, whilst in your game, a certain ingredient might be called something else.

boardgame.name: Cocktail Name Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Drinks are, for many, but not all people, something to help them relax. Cocktails are one such beverage. A cocktail is often defined as an alcoholic drink consisting of a spirit or spirits mixed with other ingredients.

Not all of these are alcoholic either because some people, for various reasons will not or cannot consume alcoholic beverages. Some names may be innocent-sounding and hit like a brick when consumed, and others are the opposite and sound extremely dangerous but have zero % alcohol.

This PDF gives you a collection of d100 tables that allows you to come up with names for various cocktails and drinks. The actual details about the cocktail will be covered in a future publication.

boardgame.name: Asunder
boardgame.description:
Addictive worker placement strategy game with cooperative battle mechanics that offers rewarding variability and high replay value.

Set in the medieval city of Edgeport, Players assume the role of one of 5 guilds and prepare to defend the city from a Monster attack. The 5 guilds are Alchemist, Paladin, Warrior, Assassin and Necromancer. Each guild has a unique Prestige card that can be improved during the game to enhance abilities.

Players take turns placing workers (Acolytes) on action spaces to collect Influence (resource cubes) to enlist Champion cards, procure Equipment, or Improve their Guild Prestige. At the end of a set of rounds, gameplay transitions to a Battle between all of the players' Champions and a randomly revealed Monster card. Battle is cooperative and is incentivized as such by some of the Equipment.

The game ends after the last Monster Battle after 10 rounds, and the player with the most Victory Points (earned through all actions and Battle damage) wins!

boardgame.name: Dinosaurs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Approximately 66 million years ago, a massive impact set off a chain of events that result in the death of the group of animals called Dinosaurs. Some of their descendants are still around today. Discoveries are being made about them all the time and new species are being found.

This PDF gives you some basic tools to tweak an existing dinosaur or make up your own. Suitable for any genre where dinosaurs are found.

Disclaimer/Warning:
Details on the dinosaurs such as their weight, size and so on are not listed in exact values, but more vague terms such as large, tiny etc. This was a deliberate design decision, otherwise, this PDF would be about 200 times bigger than it is.

boardgame.name: Fake Dinosaur Scientific Names
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Many times, all you need is a quick idea or a concept. Something to help spark your imagination or to just fill in the gaps. You don’t want a huge number of tables and need something reasonably quickly.

This is where the Quick Generator series comes in. The QG series from Ennead Games has, generally, no more than 2 x d100 tables, which can give you 10,000 possible combinations! Some of which may match up with existing ones.

This particular generator gives you fake scientific dinosaur names, along with the meaning of the words, translated from Greek or Latin.

boardgame.name: Void Name Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Void - An area of space or reality where nothing exists. It may be a rip in space-time, an area of utter devastation after a war, a place of null-energy where not even the most potent of psionic powers work.

Whatever the cause of it, this type of area can go by many names and this generator helps you to come up with one. With 2 x d100 tables, you can get up to 10,000 possible combinations, with some being more fitting and suitable for your setting than others.

Although designed with a sci-fi setting in mind, this can also be suitable for a fantasy setting and used to describe an arcane rift, or magical devastation etc.

boardgame.name: Sci-Fi Academy Class Names
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Anyone who joins a space-faring military-like organisation, or wishes to make a name for themselves amongst the stars, needs to bee educated in some way, and as a species spreads itself outwards into the void, the various subjects they might specialise in or that get taught back at home in a prestigious academy increases.

This Quick Generator gives you 2 x d100 tables to quickly come up with a name for those various classes with 10,000 possible combinations.

Although designed with Sci-Fi settings in mind this can also be used for a modern or near-modern setting.

boardgame.name: Rumour Maker - Sci-Fi Edition
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Rumours are the source of many adventures - They can tell you about possible intrigue, fabulous riches, or tall-tales. In worlds of a fantastical-nature, they can be heard in taverns, from passing bards and so-on. A science-fiction based setting has its version of this, from spaceport with travellers from across the galaxy to scoundrels looking to con a gullible rube out of their credits.

The Rumour Generator - Sci-Fi Edition is designed yo help you come up with some rumours, who they were heard from, what juicy gossip they cover and how true, or not, they are.

boardgame.name: Sci-Fi Academy Class Names - Extended Edition
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Anyone who joins a space-faring military-like organisation, or wishes to make a name for themselves amongst the stars, needs to be educated in some way, and as a species spreads itself outwards into the void, the various subjects they might specialise in or that get taught back at home in a prestigious academy increases.

The Quick Generator edition gave you 2 x d100 tables to quickly come up with a name for those various classes with 10,000 possible combinations - This one cranks that up by many notches and gives you 400 * 1200 possible combination, and even more if you use the extended descriptors option!

Some of the results you get may not, at first glance, make sense or seem very close to others, if not the same just with a different name - This is deliberate and designed to "pad out" the curriculum.

boardgame.name: Arbitrary Collection 09
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Every week on the Ennead Games blog, normally on a Friday, a helpful list of 20 items is posted. These normally follow no set pattern or theme, unless there has been a request for a particular list, but a few are based off real-world subjects. Some tables are expanded further into full lists or generators, and others work just fine on their own - all you need to use them is a d20.

The subjects range from names from classes or professions, to what you might magical classes for magic schools, to martial arts move names and more. There may be a common theme for the volume, then again, there might not be. They have been brought together into a handy and eclectic collection, a mixture of Fantasy, Sci-Fi and other genres.

boardgame.name: Alchemical Ingredient Names
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Many times, all you need is a quick idea or a concept. Something to help spark your imagination or to just fill in the gaps. You don’t want a huge number of tables and need something reasonably quickly.

This is where the Quick Generator series comes in. The QG series from Ennead Games has, generally, no more than 2 x d100 tables, which can give you 10,000 possible combinations!

This particular QG gives you two tables for coming up with an ingredient you might find useful for alchemical reactions. The name might be literal, such as Dragons Tongue is just what you think it is, or the name for a flower or root that resembles its namesake. Or maybe someone just thought the name would be amusing.

boardgame.name: Mechs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Mech, sometimes called a mecha, is a term used to describe a giant robot like machine, often humanoid shape, controlled by an internal pilot or pilots.

They can range in size and design, from ones that act as almost a set of clothing, to giant building sized behemoths of destruction and more, require the use of multiple pilots and operators. They posses, albeit smaller versions, weapons and defences sometimes found on starships.

They can move about in urban environments and act as peacekeepers, defence units or even for law-enforcement.

Whatever their purpose or role, a mech is as varied as the ones who use them. This generator series of tables is designed to help you flesh out the details.

boardgame.name: Old English
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The original name maker series from Ennead Games was designed to help you generate and come up with a name for your fictional cultures.

This companion related series took the same concept and applied it to real-world names, giving you a tool for names that are more in fitting with real life or setting and games that draw inspiration from the real world.

Not every possible name will be covered, but enough will be to give you hundreds, if not thousands of possible combinations, especially if you use the middle name option as well.

This volume covers Old English, suitable for humanoids of worlds and games that draw inspiration from around 1,000 CE and that part of the world.

boardgame.name: German
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The original name maker series from Ennead Games was designed to help you generate and come up with a name for your fictional cultures.

This companion related series took the same concept and applied it to real-world names, giving you a tool for names that are more in fitting with real-life settings and games that draw inspiration from the real world. This edition draws its content from a mixture of mostly real German names and ones that have a Germanic feel to them.

Not every possible name will be covered, but enough will be to give you hundreds, if not thousands of possible combinations, especially if you use the middle name option as well.

boardgame.name: Greek
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The original name maker series from Ennead Games was designed to help you generate and come up with a name for your fictional cultures.

This companion related series took the same concept and applied it to real-world names, giving you a tool for names that are more in fitting with real-life settings and games that draw inspiration from the real world. This edition draws its content from a mixture of mostly real Greek names and ones that have a Greek feel to them.

Not every possible name will be covered, but enough will be to give you hundreds, if not thousands of possible combinations, especially if you use the middle name option as well.

boardgame.name: Afterlife Namer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Many times, all you need is a quick idea or a concept. Something to help spark your imagination or to just fill in the gaps. You don’t want a huge number of tables and need something reasonably quickly.

This is where the Quick Generator series comes in. The QG series from Ennead Games has, generally, no more than 2 x d100 tables, which can give you 10,000 possible combinations!

This particular QG gives you two tables for coming up with a name for your afterlife, the place where souls end up after being removed from the land of the living.

boardgame.name: Squad Code Name
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Many times, all you need is a quick idea or a concept. Something to help spark your imagination or to just fill in the gaps. You don’t want a huge number of tables and need something reasonably quickly.

This is where the Quick Generator series comes in. The QG series from Ennead Games has, generally, no more than 2 x d100 tables, which can give you 10,000 possible combinations!

This particular QG gives you two tables for coming up with a code name or use name, for military style squads. This can be for fantasy genre or modern, or even science fiction. What the name actually means and its history is up to you to decide.

boardgame.name: Fantasy Genre Species Name
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Many times, all you need is a quick idea or a concept. Something to help spark your imagination or to just fill in the gaps. You don’t want a huge amount of tables and need something reasonably quickly.

This is where the Quick Generator series comes in. The QG series from Ennead Games has , generally, no more than 2 x d100 tables, which can give you 10,000 possible combinations!

This particular QG covers species (or sub-species/variants) names, suitable for the fantasy based genre, although there is nothing stopping you from using them in other genres or settings.

boardgame.name: Era Names
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Empire Builder Series has been designed to help flesh out your campaigns, empires and kingdoms. It covers currency, historical events, settlements and more.

Era Names refers to various periods of history for your empire, kingdom, country, etc. The name may be factual and exact or, like the so-called 100-years war, be a bit misleading, sometimes deliberately so. This can be the period of time as its called by historians or by those who lived during it.

Featuring 3 xd100 tables that combine in various ways to give you a suggested name for your time period.

boardgame.name: Antagonists
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This particular Helpful list series covers some of the co-called classical fantasy genre antagonist, orc/goblin, dark, elf, draconic and more.

The names listed herein not in the species or cultures natural language, but have been translated into the common tongue for ease of use.

10 lists of d100 tables provide you with 1,000 names.

boardgame.name: Fantasy Genre Names
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Helpful List series is designed to give you, as the name suggests, a list of various things that you might mind helpful. They all follow the same basic format of at least 1d100 table, sometimes more depending on the nature of the subject.

The 1k series takes this a step further, with 10 1d100 tables themed around a certain subject broken down into their own tables of 1d100 each.

This particular Helpful list series covers the co-called classical fantasy genre race of dwarfs, elf, gnomes and halfling, with Old English being used to represent the stereotypical “Medieval” humans

The names listed herein not in the species or cultures natural language, but have been translated into the common tongue for ease of use.

boardgame.name: Pirate Ship Names
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

When running a game or coming up with content for a story, you can sometimes be stuck for ideas and need inspiration quickly. The Quick Generator series is designed to help with that. At a maximum of two tables, you can come up with your required concept, suggestion or idea in a very small number of dice rolls.

This particular QG is about coming up with a name for your pirate ship. Although there is nothing stopping you from using for others ships, the name parts have been put together in such a way as to make the name sound like a ship a pirate would be proud to serve on.

boardgame.name: Cdigo Secreto: Expansin promocional Chile
boardgame.description:
10 cards with 20 typical words from Chile.
This promo pack is produced by Devir and it was given as a promo.

boardgame.name: Fortifications
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You finally have your empire, or “acquired” one. You now have to deal with pesky bandits or those who seek to usurp your rule. You may encounter a fortification of some kind on your adventures, or you may even be the one that is doing the invading on behalf of your Queen!

Whatever the reasons for finding one, a fortification covers a few things, from castles to defensive walls and more. This publication gives you the basic details of the fortification, a starting point from which to build and customise for your own world.

boardgame.name: Assorted Slang and Terminology Volume 6: Cyberpunk
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

According to Wikipedia, Cyberpunk is defined as “... a subgenre of science fiction in a futuristic setting that tends to focus on a "combination of lowlife and high tech" featuring advanced technological and scientific achievements, such as artificial intelligence and cybernetics, juxtaposed with a degree of breakdown or radical change in the social order.”

boardgame.name: Assorted Slang and Terminology Volume 5: Science-Fiction
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Assorted Slang & Terminology series is a collection of pdfs that give you a glossary or series of terms themed around a certain subject.

This edition is themed around Science-Fiction, or Sci-Fi for short, with a bit of real-world science terms thrown in for good measure.

boardgame.name: Thieves Guild Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Thieves Guild. The name conjures up a myriad of images. From dashing charming rogues to devilish and evil thieves who take what they want, when they want.

Some call them trouble makers, others see them as a valuable if contradictory dangerous, resources.

Whatever their reason for being, wherever you find people gathered together in large towns and cities, you will often find a guild and this publication is here to help give you some starting points to build from.

boardgame.name: Thieves Guild Name
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Thieves Guild is one of those tropes often found in fantasy literature and games. They can be loveable scamps fighting a good cause against an unjust ruler, or a band of miscreants delighting in acquiring wealth from others.

But, for some, simply calling them “The Thieves Guild” is boring. This quick generator can help with that problem.

boardgame.name: Artefact Names
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Artefacts are often considered items of great power, forged when the world was new by deities or mortals with access to power or knowledge that has been lost to time. Their creator may have given them a name or they have acquired one over the years, one that often reflects their powers, purpose or a secret.

The artefact generator presented here gives you a two-word name for your artefact, such as “Dreambreak” or “Titanscorch”. What their powers and abilities are is up to you.

boardgame.name: Elf Settlement Namer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Coming up with names for a settlement can be hard. For the players, it is often their hometown or place of birth, but for the GMs, it’s more than that – it’s the location NPCs call home and the hub of possible adventures.

But you can’t keep calling the place “the town” or “this city”. This is true for all races and cultures with some form of civilisation.

This product series has been designed to help you come up with names for various cultures, races/species etc. In particular, this one covers Elves.

This name generator has two parts, one for the common tongue and another for a version of the elvish/elven language.

boardgame.name: Blanks
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Pixel Loot Blanks contains 30 blank Pixel Loot cards for you to create your own treasure cards that will fit in seamlessly with any other deck of Pixel Loot cards. They share the same common back as all Pixel Loot cards, and the same decorative, but they have no text or images. You fill in the blanks with items that work in your campaign! This set contains 10 each of the three pixel loot frame colors: teal for adventuring gear, orange for weapons & armor, and purple for riches and rewards.

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: Waterloo et la Route Napolon
boardgame.description:
The Trivial Pursuit Waterloo and the Route Napoléon, on the occasion of the bicentenary of the epic Battle between Napoleon and Wellington!

330 questions and answers on the theme of Waterloo and Napoleon's road.


Le Trivial Pursuit Waterloo et la Route Napoléon, à l'occasion du bicentenaire de la Bataille épique opposant Napoléon à Wellington !

330 questions et réponses sur le thème de Waterloo et la route de Napoléon.

boardgame.name: Cyberpunks Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You stand on a rooftop as printer ink scatters the horizon, your chip player screeches to a grinding, glitchy halt. "High tech, low life" doesn't begin to describe this coterie criminals, outcasts, visionaries, dissenters and misfits that'll breathe life into your next cyberpunk campaign.

In this pack you'll find 55 top-down tokens and portraits, 280x280px each in a variety of poses so you can turn them into rollable tokens to keep things interesting. Here's a look at what's inside!

boardgame.name: Cyberpunks Vol. 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this edition of Cyberpunks I decided to create a much more colorful and interesting group of characters that'll help you get up and running in no time! Includes a cybersamurai, covert ops specialist, drone rigger, enforcer, face, hacker (complete with a retro-deck!) in attack and idle poses. Each token is transparent and is sized at 560x560px so they scale super well for VTT!

boardgame.name: Cyberpunks Vol. 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this edition of Cyberpunks I decided to build a strange team of characters that can be used as fixers, contacts, and regular player characters!

You'll also find an enormous troll enforcer, a ghoul gunslinger, a drifter with a penchant for firearms, the fruits of my drone experiments, combat mages, a paranormal investigator, an Elvis impersonator, hackers, and others too!

Each token is transparent and is sized at 560x560px so they scale super well for VTT! (please note that the Enforcer giant is a massive 1400x1400px!)

boardgame.name: Cyberpunks Vol. 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this pack we have a healthy mix of NPCs and PCs; bent detectives, cybersurgeons and cyberdocs that'll fix you up with all the 'ware you need, street punks, hotshot defense attorneys, street mages, brawlers, and even a scummy coffin hotel manager that will more likely than not rob you blind while you sleep.

I want to thank everyone that buys my packs and supports cyberpunk content. I really appreciate the heck out of you guys, and as long as you keep buying 'em I'll keep making new stuff! (I'm about to hit 100 characters created for these! How amazing is that?!)

Each token is a transparent PNG and is sized at 560x560px so they scale super well for VTT!

boardgame.name: Cyberpunks Vol. 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

From rocker punk mages, black ops agents, transhumanist fixers, yakuza, tiny dancing bots and decrepit paparazzi, this pack has a lot to offer your next game! Each character comes with an action/fight token, along with idle and prone poses so you'll have a nice variety to fit any situation. Bots going forward from this pack on will be separate characters with their own poses so you can strip 'em out and do whatever with 'em!

I want to thank everyone that buys my packs and supports cyberpunk content in general. I really appreciate the heck out of you guys, and as long as you keep buying 'em I'll keep making new stuff!

Each token is a transparent PNG and is sized at 560x560px so they scale super well for VTT!

boardgame.name: Cyberpunks Vol. 6
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this volume of Cyberpunks we've got a whole slew of bots, hackers, yakuza, security personnel and just about everything else you need to keep your campaigns interesting. Each character comes in 3 to 4 poses so you can reuse them in various campaigns without things getting boring.

I want to thank everyone that buys my packs and supports cyberpunk content in general. I really appreciate the heck out of you guys, and as long as you keep buying 'em I'll keep making new stuff!

Each token is a transparent PNG and is sized at 560x560px so they scale super well for VTT!

boardgame.name: Cyberpunks Vol. 7
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hostile eyebots, weathered ork street mages, strumming cyborg geisha, ornery paranormal detectives, grizzly biker fixers and others make this by far my favorite pack to have made. Maybe I overdid it with the cyborg dictator, giant holographic spider and street samurai but hey, this is a labor of love and I spared no expense (nor sanity!) in the making of this pack. As always each character comes in 3 to 4 poses so you can reuse them in various campaigns without things getting boring.

I want to thank everyone that buys my packs and supports cyberpunk content in general. I really appreciate the heck out of you guys, and as long as you keep buying 'em I'll keep making new stuff!

Each token is a transparent PNG and is sized at 560x560px so they scale super well for VTT!

boardgame.name: Early Modern Vol. 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tired of not being able to find that perfect "I barely have the willpower left to till this field and raise all these kids" farmer for your campaigns? Look no more! In this pack you'll find mischievous merchants, evil landlords with fancy hats, sweet princesses, tiny chickens, down-on-their-luck beggars, and others that will bring your sorta-modern but not too fantastical scenarios to life.

Most tokens measure 560x560px, while the children and kneeling beggar are all 280x280 to save space and help make them more usable/resource friendly and to keep them to scale with the others.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Animaniacs
boardgame.description:
Scene-stealing Warner siblings Yakko, Wakko, and Dot are joined by Pinky and the Brain and Dr. Otto von Scratchansniff in this reimagined Monopoly game. Players bounce around the board collecting other cast members, locations, and more from the 90s hit cartoon.

Monopoly original Description...

boardgame.name: Fraggin' Dragons Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Who ordered the Hero BBQ!?"

Has your latest campaign grown stale? Are your players bored? Do your lands have an abundance of small terrestrial mammals?

Inside this pack you'll find an assortment of chromatic and metallic dragons that will enrich gameplay and infuriate your players! 10 dragons, 3-4 poses each. There are 62 280px and 560px tokens, and this pack was recently updated to include the 25 large original "legendary" versions! To get an idea of how big these dragons are, the gold flying dragon is 1500x1000px. I'm so excited to offer these and hope you enjoy them!

I just want to say thanks to everyone that buys something! If you have a commission idea, request, question or comment feel free to reach out!

boardgame.name: Horror Monsters Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Are you a discerning DM/GM searching for the finest zombies, undead and freshly reanimated corpses for your next horror campaign? Of course you are!

In this pack you'll find your usual biters and crawlers, unfortunate medical and miltary personnel, bikers and others in various stages of decay and agitation.

Each token measures 560x560 and is uniformly rendered, features a transparent background and digitally painted so you can use them to make large hordes with my other Horror Monsters, Survivors and Street People packs.

I just want to say thanks to everyone that buys something! If you have a commission idea, request, question or comment feel free to contact me!

boardgame.name: Horror Monsters Vol. 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tired of those classic green B-movie zombies? Want some realistic and bloody disgusting undead for your next campaign? Of course you do!

In this pack you'll find almost two dozen rendered and hand-painted zombies that are ready to crawl, bite and fight your PCs.

Each token measures 560x560 and is uniformly rendered, features a transparent background and digitally painted so you can use them to make large hordes with my other Horror Monsters, Survivors and Street People packs.

I just want to say thanks to everyone that buys something! If you have a commission idea, request, question or comment feel free to contact me!

boardgame.name: Horror Survivors Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Body bags, gun-toting cat ladies, and scientists in containment suits? Oh my!

In this pack you'll find a nice collection of scientists, soldiers and civilians that'll beef up just about any horror campaign! And yes, that is a totally normal dog! Look at how healthy he looks! And so friendly!

These tokens are 560x560 pixels with varying poses so you can reuse them as quest NPCs, enemies on battle maps, etc. Tokens are uniformly rendered and digitally painted, so they seamlessly integrate with the Horror Monsters and Street People sets.

I just want to say thanks to everyone that buys something! If you have a commission idea, request, question or comment feel free to contact me!

boardgame.name: Horror Survivors Vol. 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Add first responders, paranoid preppers and hipster looters toting wine and cheeses to your next modern horror campaign with this latest installment of Horror Survivors.

These tokens are 560x560 pixels with varying poses so you can reuse them as quest NPCs, enemies on battlemaps, etc. Tokens are uniformly rendered and digitally painted, so they seamlessly integrate with the Horror Monsters and Street People sets.

I just want to say thanks to everyone that buys something! If you have a commission idea, request, question or comment feel free to contact me!

boardgame.name: Horror Survivors Vol. 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this latest installment of Horror Survivors you'll find frightened kids, murderous office workers, soldiers holding down the fort and many others that'll add life (and a little death!) to your horror campaigns.

These tokens are 560x560 pixels with varying poses and can be used as quest NPCs, enemies on battlemaps, etc. Tokens are uniformly rendered and digitally painted so they'll seamlessly integrate with the Horror Monsters and Street People sets.

I just want to say thanks to everyone that buys something! If you have a commission idea, request, question or comment feel free to contact me!

boardgame.name: Maps in a Pinch: Warehouse Construction Kit
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Have you ever wanted to visit modern logistical horrors on your players? To create vast mazes of lost packages, barrels of toxic waste, forgotten movie props and senselessly placed barriers?

Who hasn't, really?!

This kit includes transparent pngs of vehicles, boxes and crates, barriers, floor markings, parking curbs, stairs, piles of boxes and more - all you have to do and put it together!

boardgame.name: Street People Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tired of having your campaign maps all empty and sad aside from PCs and the occasional legendary enemy that's trying to frag your team? Street People's got you covered! This pack is full of cyberpunk schoolgirls, beat cops, street shamans, mysterious strangers, totally legitimate businessmen, random pedestrians and others that'll bring more life to your stories!

I just want to say thanks to everyone that buys something! If you have a commission idea, request, question or comment feel free to send me a message through my publisher page or find me on Twitter as @sunsetndustries, and on Instagram @sunsetindustries (lots of works in progress shots over there)!

Each token is a transparent PNG and is sized at 560x560px so they scale super well for VTT!

boardgame.name: Street People Vol. 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You're walking down a cold rainy street, listening to the soft pitter-patter of pedestrians all around you. A giant throws up his hands across the street, ranting and raving about the Illuminati and the dangers of cutting sandwiches into triangles, while a few out-of-place prep school kids loiter near a cross walk smoking lemon-cake flavored e-cigs.

A dwarven police lieutenant eyes them while gnawing on his cigar - then he turns his eye to you. Not good!

In this pack you'll find 23 different orks, trolls, elves, dwarves and even an Oni that can be added into your games as background, contacts, or even be used as PCs, if you like!

Each token is a transparent PNG and is sized at 560x560px so they scale super well for VTT!

boardgame.name: Street People Vol. 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You're walking down a cold rainy street, listening to the soft pitter-patter of pedestrians all around you. A ballerina rocking a Max Headroom sweater pirouettes through neon shadows, an elven businessman swears at his phone and a policeman starts shouting at someone across the street.

Lights glitter in the dark, a vampire beckons you into her establishment. You turn to run away - and you can, because you're using Street People Vol. 3!

In this pack you'll find humans, elves, dwarves and more that can be added to your games as background, contacts, and even used as PCs too!

Now characters come in front/left/right/back/sitting positions, so you'll be able to use them to people multiple maps and create crowds on the fly. Everything is lit and rendered with the same cameras as other packs so you can use them interchangeably with ease.

In this pack are 67 tokens; all backgrounds are transparent and measure 280x280.

boardgame.name: Street People Vol. 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You're walking down a cold rainy street, listening to the soft pitter-patter of pedestrians all around you. A ballerina rocking a Max Headroom sweater pirouettes through neon shadows, an elven businessman swears at his phone and a policeman starts shouting at someone across the street.

Lights glitter in the dark, a vampire beckons you into her establishment. You turn to run away - and you can, because you're using Street People Vol. 3!

In this pack you'll find humans, elves, dwarves and more that can be added to your games as background, contacts, and even used as PCs too!

Now characters come in front/left/right/back/sitting positions, so you'll be able to use them to people multiple maps and create crowds on the fly. Everything is lit and rendered with the same cameras as other packs so you can use them interchangeably with ease.

In this pack are 67 tokens; all backgrounds are transparent and measure 280x280.

boardgame.name: Street People Vol. 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You're walking down a cold rainy street, listening to the soft pitter-patter of pedestrians all around you. A loud ork in a short order cook uniform hollers an order in a food truck to your left, while an old elven man stares off into the distance to your right. Across the street you see a VR addict dancing under a street lamp, off in a world of their own. A happy yet weathered man stands close to the food truck, saying that while he'd like his childhood back he'd accept a taco too.

Further away in the darkness behind you, tucked away from all the neon lights and street signs you see a halfling in an LED raincoat, hiding under an umbrella. You wonder what kind of rare items they're peddling - and now you can find out, because this is Street People Vol. 5!

In this pack you'll find humans, elves, dwarves and more that can be added to your games as background, contacts, and even used as PCs too! Each character comes in a variety of positions so you can use them to build quick crowds and more natural groups of people throughout your maps.

In this pack are 65 tokens; all backgrounds are transparent and measure 280x280.

boardgame.name: Street People Vol. 6
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You're walking down a cold rainy street, listening to the soft pitter-patter of pedestrians all around you. An insistent woman pleads with a passer-by, warning them that "The Machine God Lies" and that they have to join together to stop it before it's too late. A chubby cyborg guards a doorway, smoking his cigarette and keeping an eye on the action.

A man in an ivory-white face mask and an energy shield vest walks down the street, looking for trouble. The hustle and bustle of the city never ends - and with all the new characters in Street People 6 it never has to!

In this pack you'll find humans, elves, dwarves and more that can be added to your games as background, contacts, and even used as PCs too! Each character comes in a variety of positions so you can use them to build quick crowds and more natural groups of people throughout your maps.

boardgame.name: DCC Character Class Tokens
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The perfect accessory to play with any Dungeon Crawl Classics game on a virtual tabletop! This set of tokens allows you to bring stunning visuals to your online session. All art is from hand-painted originals, scanned and formatted for online play. The look and feel of these tokens capture the spirit of DCC gaming and its Appendix N origins, yet is scaled and prepared for play online.

Inside this map+token pack you will find:


Twenty full-color tokens to represent both male and female characters of every class from DCC RPG. Almost all of these tokens are original hand-painted images created just for this release.


This VTT token pack is designed to be played with Dungeon Crawl Classics. You can use the graphics herein without the adventure, but you’ll get the most out of them if you also own the adventure.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Airship Docks Battle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Stone rails have been made rumble while wooden struts and slats burn, damaged by the bombardment that has hit the port. Blood runs in the streets as guards attempt to stave off the enemy.

Cranes that are used to off-load goods hang over the railings, fire trailing from their forms. Crates and barrels have been damaged and In the center of the dock, below the rails the stabilizing fan is bloodied and broken.

Adventure Seed

A large explosion jolts you from your slumber as the port shakes from the force. The towns streets fill with smoke as houses begin to burn and rumble covers the paths where people huddle for safety. When you enter the streets a man in guardsmen garb comes around the corner clutching his sword and his side, blood dripping between his fingers.

Behind him a women in a colorful shawl stands close, he eyes you up and down noticing your armaments as he falls to one knee coughing blood. After finishing his coughing and wiping blood away from his mouth he straight up demands that you assist him, noting his rank as lieutenant of guard. He explains the women behind him is an important person and may be the target of this monstrous attack.

She must be escorted to the airships at once before the town is to fall, for the information that she carries should it fall to the enemy would, may mean the end of the entire kingdom.

When you get to the docks you see the bodies of several guards men among the ruins and flames as well as several other men walking around with long swords, skewering anyone that is still alive.

Beyond them lies but a few of the remaining functional airships.

What’s going on? The women in the colorful shawl worked as an archaeologist for a wealthy but secretive benefactor whom had paid her a fortune to help unravel the mystery of an ancient portal and the scrolls it was found with. Through her effort she finally figure out it’s function and was horrified. She confided with her employer, who was ecstatic hearing the news, explaining to her that he intended to use this weapon to take over the kingdom or bring it to ruin, to usher in a new age.

It was then she realized she had been fooled into helping bring this weapon back to life, so she fled, destroying what little work she could before leaving.

When she arrived in the town the guard’s didn’t take her story of evil villain who intended on using an ancient super weapon to take over the kingdom seriously, neither the imminent attack she foresaw from this villain in an effort to retrieve her. Instead they put her in a cell as if she was a crazy person.

It was only when the attack began that the lieutenant began to believe her story and couldn’t very well leave her in the cell.

boardgame.name: Les Jeux Conficulture: Rhums & Cocktails
boardgame.description:
The Conficulture Quiz is your new card game to play with family or friends. On each card, guess the correct answer using 3 clues.

Discover the techniques and specialties "Rums & Cocktails" while having fun.

If a player/team gets the correct answer with the first clue, they keep the card and get 2 more random cards. If they get the answer after the second clue, they received the card plus 1 random card. If they get it after the third clue, they keep just that card.

Game end can be when a team acquires a certain number of points (cards) or when the deck is depleted. Player/team with the most points, wins.


Le Quizz Conficulture est votre nouveau jeu de cartes à jouer en famille ou entre amis. Sur chaque carte, devinez la bonne réponse à l’aide de 3 indices.

Partez à la découverte des techniques et spécialités « Rhums & Cocktails » en vous amusant.

Vous êtes plutôt adepte de l’apéro ? Retrouvez immédiatement l’épisode : « Rhums & Cocktails »
