boardgame.name: Les Jeux Conficulture: Episode 2 Tradition: La Runion
boardgame.description:
Card game to play with family or friends.
On each card, guess the correct answer using 3 clues.

This deck focuses on the heritage of the island of la Réunion.

If a player/team gets the correct answer with the first clue, they keep the card and get 2 more random cards. If they get the answer after the second clue, they received the card plus 1 random card. If they get it after the third clue, they keep just that card.

Game end can be when a team acquires a certain number of points (cards) or when the deck is depleted. Player/team with the most points, wins.

Each set of 33 cards is supplied in a plastic box, convenient for storing your quiz and protecting it during transport.


Jeu de cartes à jouer en famille ou entre amis.
Sur chaque carte, devinez la bonne réponse à l’aide de 3 indices.

Ce jeu met l'accent sur le patrimoine de l'île de la Réunion.

Chaque jeu de 33 cartes vous est fourni dans une Boite plastique, pratique pour ranger votre quizz et le protéger lors des transports.

boardgame.name: 5150 Back Alley Bright Lights
boardgame.description:
Welcome to New Hope City, where everyone deserves a second chance.

Back Alleys, Bright Lights is the blend of lite Role-Playing with a quick and easy set of combat rules. Combined, these will enhance your games and move your Story along at a brisk pace. New Hope City is home to over a dozen different Races, some friendly and some not so. You can choose to play as one of over a dozen Professions, where what’s legal is up to your interpretation.

Totally playable solo with rules for a Campaign with a simple way to gauge how well, or bad, you’re doing! Compatible with our other 5150 rules.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

Discover the Gastronomy of the "Martinique" destination while having fun.

Spell Effects: 5E Essentials, from Arcknight Digital


A wide array of Spell Effects, covering all of the classics needed to play DnD on Virtual Tabletop.
Quality Art
Transparency Effects

Over EIGHTY (80) Templates and Tokens


The 5E Essentials set of Spell Effects is really all you need to play your favorite roleplaying games on virtual tabletop. This set includes various circles, squares, cones, lines, and dozens of tokens including:

Dozens of Buff, Debuff, and Summon Tokens.

boardgame.name: Roar and Write!: Deep Dive

The Deep Dive sheet pack gives you a new way to play Roar and Write, with new scoring opportunities and new council members to impress. Can you impress the council so that they choose you to rule the Kingdoms of the Deep?

Roar and Write! base game is a competitive press-your-luck game about impressing different council members on the selection committee, garnering favor throughout the five kingdoms, and completing your own personal objectives to rise to the top of the selection committee's choices for the new ruler of the Animal Kingdoms.

—description from the publisher

Do you have what it takes to win over the members on the Selection Committee before the time runs out?

boardgame.description:

This list contains 100 different professionals that are perfect drop ins for a modern/crime role playing game. This list is also useful for survivors for a post apocalyptic or zombie outbreak setting as well as a cyberpunk/near future dystopia that has many existing modern day occupations and elements. boardgame.name: The Balkan Naval War
The Balkan Naval War: A Naval Campaign and Fast Play Rules Covering the Balkan War, 1912-13
boardgame.description:
The Balkan Naval War is a mini campaign covering the naval side of the Balkan Wars of 1912-13 in the Black Sea, the Aegean and the Mediterranean.

The campaign has been written with LFG's Broadside and Salvo quick play rules in mind, but is adapable to any set of pre-dreadnought or WW1 naval rules.

Also included is a brief history of the naval campaign, the Broadside and Salvo fast play pre-dreadnought rules and a complete set of ship data in Broadside and Salvo format, allowing the campaign to be fought out over a weekend or a few club nights.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Honeybee Mayhem

Rumors say that a mysterious monster appeared in Honeybrew town. The monster wanders around the town and spreads terror, and finally, two young dwarves got hurt by the beast. Can adventurers protect the village from this monster?

When word reaches Breland that the Lord of Blades is plotting an attack, the outpost of Salvation becomes the first line of defense. In preparation for war, the Brelish army enlists the adventurers to secure the outpost, serving under the vainglorious General Karol Tyresh; a buffoon known to his troops as “Lord Bucket.”

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 9, this is the second in a trilogy of adventures, the Dogs of War storyline.

boardgame.name: Foreign Affairs
boardgame.description:

An invitation to the storm giant court of King Hekaton becomes a continent-spanning mystery that could change the face of Faerûn.

A six-hour adventure for Tier 3 characters.

boardgame.name: Challenge Rating: Getting the Most out of CR for Improvisation and Monster Design
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Challenge Rating system in D&D 5e promises to be an easy way to make balanced, enjoyable monsters, encounters, and whole adventures, and is a foundational part of the game. Adventures, monsters, and treasures are all organized and understood by their CR. However, the vast majority of D&D players and dungeon masters find the way CR is presented unsatisfactory or downright confusing, so don't use CR to much effect.

Challenge Rating: Getting the Most out of CR for Improvisation and Monster Design is a re-worked presentation of the core D&D 5e CR. In it, I detail my approach to making CR work for me to quickly pull together improvisation-friendly adventures and encounters. I also show how to use the monster designing guidelines in the Dungeon Master's Guide the way you've always wanted to: pick a CR, slap on some special abilities, and have a fun and balanced new foe in a couple of minutes.

This isn't a variant CR system or a new way to make monsters work in D&D. All of the rules presented here are 100% core Dungeons and Dragons, but re-worked and presented in a way that makes them radically more straightforward and usable at your table. Chapter 1 shows you how to trust CR to abstract away the math behind a challenging encounter, so that you can focus on story and roleplaying when outlining an upcoming adventure. Chapter 2 shows you an efficient system to use CRs to prepare infinitely-reusable lists of monsters, letting you do all the math once for an encounter type you'll be able to use for parties of any size and level (some examples like "Necromancer Cabal" and "Bandit Camp" are provided). Chapter 3 re-works the monster design guidelines in the Dungeon Master's Guide so that you can start with a target CR and then quickly make a monster that fits.

My hope in writing this book is to empower you to understand and use the monster math in D&D to make your own adventure planning faster and more focused on the story, leaving questions of balance up to the system that is supposed to handle them.

boardgame.name: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden Dice and Miscellany
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Immerse yourself in an Icewind Dale Dungeons & Dragons adventure with a full set of 11 dice (two d20s, one d12, two d10s, one d8, four d6s, and one d4) made for the frozen north.

Navigate the treacherous tundra with a player-friendly, foldout map of Icewind Dale on one side and Ten-Towns on the other (10.5" × 15.75").

Keep your dice on the table with a durable, felt-lined box that functions as two dice trays.

20 double-sided cards with descriptions and beautiful illustrations will introduce you to the characters and creatures you might encounter on your D&D journey.

For use with the Dungeons & Dragons fifth edition Player's Handbook, Monster Manual, and Dungeon Master's Guide.

Contents: 11 dice; foldout map (10.5" × 15.75"); 1 box (doubles as 2 dice trays); 20 double-sided character and creature cards

Especially designed along with the 3D Monuments, the Plastic Ankh tokens fit perfectly in the slots of 3D Pyramids, Obelisks, Temples, and Sphinxes. Each God needs 16 tokens, but this set contains 15 because we're already replacing 1 cardboard token from each god for a plastic one, in the Core Box, Pantheon, and Stretch Goals, since those are better suited to use as Devotion trackers.

boardgame.name: Encapsulate
boardgame.description:
Encapsulate is a 2-4 player dexterity game where players each take turns flicking their colorful cubes onto a handmade wooden board consisting of a 7x7 grid.

If you get your cubes into a line, instead of flicking, you can take a scoring turn which removes any of your points-scoring cubes from the board. Orthogonal lines are good, but diagonal lines score even more points!

But the name of the game comes from your power to Encapsulate other players' cubes, even off turn. This not only scores you points, but removes your opponent's cubes from the board.

The score track is integrated into the board and other player's scoring markers, not to mention errant cubes, can allow your marker to leapfrog into the lead. Be the first to reach the end of the score track to win the game.

As the game progresses, a beautiful pattern grows on the table.

boardgame.name: Gaiapolis
Gaiapolis: Sword of the Golden Hawk
Gaiaporisu: gon Taka no Tsurugi
boardgame.description: Prince Gerard Himerce seeks vengeance against the Zar Harc Empire for the destruction of his homeland, the Kingdom of Avalon. Joined by the half-human fairy Elaine Shee, last survivor of her clan, and Galahad, an exiled duke from the land of the dragons, the Prince goes on a journey to prevent King Darkness (formerly known as Albert Himerce, Gerard's older brother), the leader of Zar Harc, from reviving an ancient demon. Along the way, they are guided by a mysterious spirit known as the Warrior of Flame, who tells them to seek three keys that have been scattered around the world in order to enter the floating citadel of Gaiapolis.

boardgame.name: Robodemons
boardgame.description: The player controls a boomerang-wielding hero whose mission is to destroy the robotic demon army of the evil king Kull.[2] There are seven levels in Robodemons, which are titled the "levels of" Bone, Flesh, Fire, Condemned Souls, Demon's Quarters, Robodemon Factory and Kull's Palace.[2]

boardgame.name: Kitchen Rush (Revised Edition): Aber bitte mit Sahne
Kitchen Rush (Revised Edition): Time for Dessert!
boardgame.description:
It wasn't long ago that the players bought an old restaurant and received their first guests. Their restaurant grew, more demanding guests came and they were able to hire more staff. Unfortunately, the success didn't last long and the restaurant became quiet. The number of guests decreased, temporary workers had to be let go and not all damage in the restaurant could be repaired. So the players decided that the restaurant needed a change. It is high time to add a pastry shop to the restaurant and serve sweet desserts: tiramisu, crème brûlée and fancy sundaes – because it's Time for Dessert!?

The expansion Time for Dessert! introduces a new type of order. By taking advantage of additional actions and using ingredients such as fruit, cream and ice cream, the players have to satisfy the demanding wishes of the guests. A specialist helps to carry out actions twice in one go, but also needs more time to do so. If the players use their earned money for investments, these bring advantages in every shift. As in the basic game, all new rules are conveyed over the course of several scenarios.

While the story begins after the end of the last Kitchen Rush scenario, players only need to know the rules of the first four scenarios in order to play the expansion. Each of the seven new scenarios introduces new elements. Each group can decide for themselves whether they play the entire campaign or simply repeat the scenario that they enjoy the most.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Menagerie of Space and Time
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four characters of level 7

Long before the first dwarf delved or the eldest elves walked among primeval woods, a race of beings had already spread among the stars. These enigmatic creatures may yet dwell somewhere beyond the sky, but none have ever set foot upon this world. They did not have to. Not when their ships could make the journey for them. An inquisitive people, these Far Ones were great students of arcane science and natural philosophy.

The probes they designed were meant to visit distant worlds, record the dominant life forms they discovered there, then move on to the next. One such probe just woke from its long slumber. In the process of reactivating long-dormant systems, this ship has managed to catch the attention of less exotic natural philosophers in the region.

boardgame.name: Card Powers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some heroes wield bows, others swords and other still dare to carry the weapon of the criminal – a gun! But then, there are a few that employ strange and unorthodox weaponry, such as a deck of cards. From summoning out the creatures in game cards to visualizing the future, the Hero focuses their power through the cards themselves, weaving fates and unleashing forces in whimsical and mysterious ways.

This sourcebook contains:

Expanded Card Descriptors and Card Features
Offensive Powers: 52 Pickup, Card Throwing and two more powers
Defensive Powers: Counter-Play, Reverse Card and two more powers
Movement Powers: Play Environment and The River & the Street
Utility Powers:Card-Kinetics, Fortune Telling, Restore Life Points and five more powers
Other Powers: Card Conjuration, Cheat, House of Cards and four more powers
Card Complications: Cost, Luck of the Draw, Requirements and all-new three more complications.

boardgame.name: Madness Powers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

We base our perception of reality on concepts and fundamentals we accept as true. Thus, we accept without question day follows night, gravity keeps us on the ground, and two objects cannot occupy the same space at the same time. Upon encountering an inexplicable event, our brain must find a way to comprehend the experience, often by reacting with skepticism and disbelief as the first line of defense. What happens, however, when the mind confronts contradictory truths? Once the mind accepts two mutually exclusive or impossible possibilities at the same time, reality as we understand it loses its predictable, dependable nature. After we can no longer explain the experiences of our senses, we slip into madness.

This sourcebook contains:

Expanded Madness Descriptors and Madness Features
Offensive Powers: Contagious Madness,Hysterical Blindness, Mind Shatter and eight more powers
Defensive Powers: Death Undone, Mind Over Body, Warded Psyche and three more powers
Movement Powers: Dream Travel
Utility Powers:Detect Madness, Glimpse the Future and two more powers
Madness Complications: Disability, Obligations, Quirk, Secrets and all-new three more complications.

boardgame.name: Survive the Hunter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

System Neutral tool for use with any RPG

5e Compatible

Hazoul: A new Race for your games.
Hazoul monster version: Allow your players to face a Hazoul.
Sethren, the Hero Hunter: a new boss to put on the track of your party.

boardgame.name: No Way!
boardgame.description:
No Way! is best described as the game of bluff, lies and surprise. You win by a combination of conning your way to victory and sniffing out the bluffs and downright lies of other players. You'll learn some weird and wonderful 'facts' along the way, but to win in this game it's not what you know... it's the way that you tell it.

You can choose to tell the truth (often stranger than fiction)or try to lie with a straight face. Select from the wacky but oddly believable falsehoods on the card, or take the plunge with a Double Bluff entirely of your own invention... that could double your points. Fortune favours the brave. The winner is the first to reach the 25-point target.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Librarians 5E
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Contents:

Librarian Class: A new class for your games.
Evelus Turiel: A new NPC with background lore.
Nevarah Lanensbhul: A new NPC with Background Lore.
The Word Caravan: An Adventure Hook for your games.***All the contents listed are meant to be used as stand-alone material for the "Librarians" game tool or inside of your ongoing campaigns by reskinning and adapting them to best fit your games.

boardgame.name: Face the Colossus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Yufereus: A new magma-based creature. 5E digital card Rules included

The Magma Colossus: A new boss. 5E Digital card Rules included

boardgame.name: Garrison at Longpick
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Problems have arisen at the island prison of Longpick. With "professional" soldiers several days away, the Council of Haddonfield has asked the party to move up the coast and render assistance!

Although set in the Pangia Campaign, this adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system. This scenario was created for a group of mid-level (5th to 7th) adventurers.

boardgame.name: Rules of Engagement: Quick Naval Combat Rules
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

We here at 2 Old Guys Games started by and continue to publish nautical adventures (Sinking the Stercorarius, Behold! The Aethernauts Rise!). To that end, we have decided that a set of naval combat rules for DCC are in order. These have shown up in bits and pieces of other adventures that are in progress or published by us. It made sense that we have a published set of rules all in one place for quick reference. Having played some great naval combat tabletop games like Sails of Glory, it was imperative that these rules not bog down the feel of DCC nor create such a complex construct that it subsumes the role-playing game that they’re inside of. To that end, we give you Rules of Engagement, Quick Naval Combat Rules for DCC.

What's inside?

A quick 6-page ruleset including cannon combat and boarding.
Cannon reloading and firing mechanics
Action for all PCs during combat (not just pilots and gunners)
Handy dandy reference cards for Combat Action Options
INTERACTIVE Cannon Reload and Cannon Hit Trackers
Ship Orientation Handout - for determining positions and bonuses.
Optional Rules - including Wind, Detailed Piloting, Magic in Naval Combat
Ship tokens with and without cannons firing.
An Open water map.
All that is jam-packed into an unsinkable package ready to set sail and blow holes in your enemy's hulls!
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Power Armor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Power Up!
Step into high-tech sci-fi combat using the 5E rules with Power Armor and unleash martial and mechanical mayhem! Within these pages you'll find extensive rules for power armor from simple servo suits to high-grade mobile artillery platforms. Customize your armored suit with three dozen special accessories, heavy weaponry, and projectiles from boost thrusters, grenade launchers, and rail guns with entropic, hellbore, and zombiemaker ammunition, or augment your character with cybernetic automata like implanted weaponry and quickstrider legs. Plus, you'll find five specialized fighter archetypes perfect for blending physical strength with high-tech armor and weaponry including the artillerist, gravitic, jump trooper, siege walker, and titan! This book is an awesome accompaniment to any campaign world with advanced technology, including the best-selling Aethera Campaign Setting from Legendary Games.

boardgame.name: MicroMacro: A Cidade do Crime
MicroMacro: Crime City
MicroMacro: Glpaborgin
MicroMacro: Krimilinn
MicroMacro: nusikaltim miestas
MicroMacro: Rikospaikalla
MicroMacro:
MikroMakro: Msto zloinu
MikroMakro: Na Tropie Zbrodni
boardgame.description:
Crimes have taken place all over the city, and you want to figure out exactly what's happened, so you'll need to look closely at the giant city map (75 x 110 cm / 29.5 x 43 inches) to find all the hidden information and trace the trails of those who had it in for their foes.

MicroMacro: Crime City includes 16 cases for you to solve. Each case includes a number of cards that ask you to find something on the map or uncover where someone has gone or otherwise reveal information relevant to a case. The city map serves as a map in time as well as space, so you'll typically find people in multiple locations throughout the streets and buildings, and you need to piece together what happened, whether by going through the case card by card or by reading only the starting card in the case and trying to figure out everything that happened for yourself. Will you be able to answer all questions about the case without fail?

MicroMacro: Crime City - Edition Spielwiese Willkommen in Crime City, einer Stadt, in der hinter jeder Ecke das Verbrechen lauert. Verhngnisvolle Geheimnisse, hinterhltige berflle und kaltbltige Morde sind hier an der Tagesordnung. Die rtliche Polizei ist nicht mehr in der Lage, die Geschehnisse zu kontrollieren. Daher ist die Arbeit pfiffiger Ermittler gefragt. MicroMacro: Crime City ist ein kooperatives Detektivspiel. Gemeinsam lsen die Spieler 16 knifflige Kriminalflle, indem sie Motive ermitteln, Beweise finden und die Tter berfhren. Ein aufmerksames Auge ist ebenso gefragt wie kreative Kombinationsgabe, um auf dem 75 x 110 cm groen Spielplan alles zu entrtseln. Als kleine Hilfe ist dazu im Spiel eine Lupe enthalten.
Ein Spieler bernimmt die Rolle des Kommissars und ist dafr verantwortlich, die Fallkarten vorzulesen (rtselt aber natrlich auch mit). Die Spieler whlen gemeinsam aus, welchen Fall sie spielen und der Kommissar liest die entsprechende Startkarte sowie die erste Aufgabe vor. Gemeinsam erkunden die Spieler den Stadtplan von Crime City, um nach und nach alle Fragen auf den Fallkarten zu beantworten. Das Spiel endet, sobald die letzte Fallkarte richtig beantwortet wurde.
Inhalt: 1 Spielplan 16 Umschlge 120 Fall-Karten 1 Lupe (inkl. Sticker) 1 Anleitung

boardgame.name: OMFG!
boardgame.description:
This may be the rudest, shockingly funny bluffing game you have ever played! Can you sort out the facts from the fiction? Can you sniff out outrageous lies and downright bullshit? You'll learn some toe-curling and bewildering facts along the way - but to win this game it't not what you know, it's the way that you tell it.

You can choose to speak the truth (often stranger than fiction) or dish out some deadpan deceit. Select from the scandalous, but oddly believable 'facts' on the card, or wing it with a Double Bluff that could pile on your points. Do you have what it takes to fool your friends? Do they?

A strictly adult party game, not for the easily embarrassed, to make you laugh out loud within the context of a genuinely competitive game. The winner is the first to reach 25 points.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Crown the Unicorn
boardgame.description:
This is a fun children's tile game of search and find, suitable for anyone from 4 years old to grown ups. It's easy to set up and simple to play.

'The lion and the unicorn were fighting for the crown.' The unicorn won the crown, but the lion has chased her into the forest. As she escaped the unicorn dropped the crown somewhere on the forest path, where you have found it. You want to return her crown, but can you find the unicorn? Can you avoid the angry lion? Don't worry if you come across the dragon - he is friendly and will help you on your way.

Be the first to find and crown the unicorn.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Les Jeux Conficulture: Episode 2 Tradition: La Guadeloupe
boardgame.description:
The Conficulture Quiz is a card game to be played with family or friends. On each card, guess the correct answer using 3 clues.

Discover the TRADITION of the "Guadeloupe" destination while having fun.

If a player/team gets the correct answer with the first clue, they keep the card and get 2 more random cards. If they get the answer after the second clue, they received the card plus 1 random card. If they get it after the third clue, they keep just that card.

Game end can be when a team acquires a certain number of points (cards) or when the deck is depleted. Player/team with the most points, wins.

Your set of 33 cards is supplied to you in a plastic box, practical for storing your quiz and protecting it during transport.


Le Quiz Conficulture est un jeu de cartes à jouer en famille ou entre amis. Sur chaque carte, devinez la bonne réponse à l’aide de 3 indices.

Partez à la découverte de la TRADITION de la destination « Guadeloupe » en vous amusant.

Votre jeu de 33 cartes vous est fourni dans une Boite plastique, pratique pour ranger votre quizz et le protéger lors des transports.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Faiyum
Fayn
boardgame.description:
The oasis-like basin Faiyum was artificially built 3,900 years ago by enlarging the Bahr Yussef channel that connected to the Nile to create a regulated flood plain. During the Middle Kingdom of Egypt, this swampland was slowly changed into farmland under the aegis of pharaohs such as Amenemhet III and Sesostris II. They ordered their advisors to build a system of canals and dikes to reclaim the land surrounded by desert and inhabited by crocodiles to turn it into a granary for Egypt.

Now, during the reign of Amenemhet III, you are the pharaoh's advisors, commanded to harvest goods, build roads, found settlements, and do much more for the good of Faiyum! You are being supplied with the necessary manpower, resources, and money, which means that if another advisor needs to use "your" roads, farms, and other buildings, they may do so since everything you build is owned by the pharaoh. The only thing you will own is the only thing that matters: the respect of the pharaoh.

Faiyum is a strategic game for enthusiasts of planning games. The basic rules are simple: Play your cards one by one on your personal discard stack. After playing some or all of your cards, you take them back into your hand in "reverse" playing order, so playing cards in the best order is important. Newly purchased cards go directly into your hand, so the timing of getting and playing them is important, too. Each of the individual cards has easy-to-understand actions, but only by creating the best combined "engine" will you be a master advisor of Faiyum.

This game features a card mechanism reminiscent of deck builders and the market mechanism successfully used in Power Grid. Gain more and more valuable cards, and use the structures built on the game board to your advantage — in other words, for your reputation. In the end, the most cunning advisor who creates the best card combinations will win Faiyum.

Spieleranzahl: 1 bis 5 Spieler Spieldauer: 2 Stunden Altersempfehlung: 12+
FAIYUM (DE & US) - Das Strategiespiel im antiken gypten Das oasenartige Becken Faiyum wurde vor ca. 3.900 Jahren als knstlich angelegtes berschwemmungsgebiet genutzt, indem die Region durch den Bahr Yusuf Kanal mit dem Nil verbunden wurde. Whrend des Mittleren Reichs in gypten wurde dieses Sumpfland unter mehreren Knigen wie Amenemhet III. und Sesostris II. langsam in Ackerland umgewandelt. Sie beauftragten ihre Berater mit dem Bau eines Kanal- und Deichsystems, um das Land, das voll mit Krokodilen und umgeben von Wste war, zu urbanisieren und in die Kornkammer fr ganz gypten zu verwandeln.
Whrend der Regierungszeit von Pharao Amenemhet III. seid ihr nun die Berater des Pharaos. Ihr habt den Auftrag Rohstoffe zu ernten, Wege zu bauen, Siedlungen zu grnden und vieles mehr, alles zum Wohle von Faiyum! Ihr erhaltet Zugriff auf die notwendigen Arbeitskrfte, Rohstoffe und Geld, um das eine Ziel zu erreichen: Erlangt den Respekt des Pharaos. Natrlich unternehmt ihr all diese Anstrengungen nicht fr euer eigenes Wohl, sondern im Namen des Pharaos. Bentigen die anderen Berater eure Wege, Betriebe oder anderen Gebude, drfen sie das. Alles, was ihr erschafft, gehrt dem Pharao.
Spielidee Faiyum ist ein strategisches Spiel fr Liebhaber von planbaren Spielen. Die grundlegenden Spielregeln sind uerst simpel: Spielt eure Karten eine nach der anderen auf euren persnlichen Ablagestapel. Nachdem ihr (fast) alle Karten gespielt habt, nehmt ihr sie wieder auf die Hand, und zwar in der umgekehrten Reihenfolge beginnend mit der zuletzt gespielten Karte. Da ihr neu gekaufte Karten sofort auf die Hand nehmt, ist die Reihenfolge, in der ihr eure Karten nutzt, deshalb besonders wichtig. Jede der individuellen Karten bietet einfach zu verstehende Aktionen, aber nur auf der Suche nach der besten Kombination an Karten wirst du zum Meisterberater in Faiyum.
In diesem Spiel verwendet ihr einen an Deckbau erinnernden Kartenmechanismus und den erfolgreich in Funkenschlag genutzten Marktmechanismus. Erhaltet immer strkere Karten und nutzt die von allen auf dem Spielplan gebauten Strukturen zu eurem Vorteil, indem ihr euer Ansehen mehrt. Kombiniert die verschiedenen Kartenaktionen und erhaltet das meiste Ansehen. Der cleverste Berater wird Faiyum gewinnen.
Zweisprachige Ausgabe (Deutsch & Englisch) - mit herausfordernder Solo-Kampagne!

boardgame.name: I Wish I Didn't Know!
boardgame.description:
ADULTS ONLY: This game contains mature content and is designed for ages 17+. NOT intended for children. Trust us.

I WISH I DIDN’T KNOW: Compete with your friends and family by guessing which gross fact is actually true. Just read off the answer choices and hear your audience groan! By the end, you’ll all be experts on all things you wish you didn’t know. Brought to you by the creators of What Do You Meme.

HOW TO PLAY: Players rotate drawing a trivia card while the rest of the group competes to guess which answer is correct. Once everyone has guessed, the judge reveals the correct answer and awards one point to those who chose correctly. The player with the most points at the end of the game takes the crown.

WHAT’S INSIDE: Contains 500 trivia cards plus instructions. Printed on premium playing cards (thick with gloss finish), shrink-wrapped in a custom box.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Puerto Rico
boardgame.description:
Puerto Rico, as part of the Alea Revised Big Box Series, is a redesigned version of the classic game from 2002, similar to the 2011 Anniversary Edition of Puerto Rico.

The box contains all official expansions and promos that have been released up to this point.

About the game:
In Puerto Rico players assume the roles of colonial governors on the island of Puerto Rico. The aim of the game is to amass victory points by shipping goods to Europe or by constructing buildings.

Each player uses a separate small board with spaces for city buildings, plantations, and resources. Shared between the players are three ships, a trading house, and a supply of resources and doubloons.

The resource cycle of the game is that players grow crops which they exchange for points or doubloons. Doubloons can then be used to buy buildings, which allow players to produce more crops or give them other abilities. Buildings and plantations do not work unless they are manned by colonists.

During each round, players take turns selecting a role card from those on the table (such as "Trader" or "Builder"). When a role is chosen, every player gets to take the action appropriate to that role. The player that selected the role also receives a small privilege for doing so - for example, choosing the "Builder" role allows all players to construct a building, but the player who chose the role may do so at a discount on that turn. Unused roles gain a doubloon bonus at the end of each turn, so the next player who chooses that role gets to keep any doubloon bonus associated with it. This encourages players to make use of all the roles throughout a typical course of a game.

Puerto Rico uses a variable phase order mechanic, where a "governor" token is passed clockwise to the next player at the conclusion of a turn. The player with the token begins the round by choosing a role and taking the first action.

Players earn victory points for owning buildings, for shipping goods, and for manned "large buildings." Each player's accumulated shipping chips are kept face down and come in denominations of one or five. This prevents other players from being able to determine the exact score of another player. Goods and doubloons are placed in clear view of other players and the totals of each can always be requested by a player. As the game enters its later stages, the unknown quantity of shipping tokens and its denominations require players to consider their options before choosing a role that can end the game.

boardgame.name: Druid Circle: Circle of Scavengers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“From the creatures that have fallen, I shall grow my power. As they replenish the earth, so shall they replenish me.”
- Sharvall Cidd, Druid of the Underlands

Druids of the Circle of Scavengers bear witness to the cycles of nature and thrive in the areas that most avoid. Using the carcasses and remains of the beasts around them, these druids create scavenger sculpts that they use to clad themselves and transform their bodies, taking power from the energies that these creatures leave behind. Although they may seem like a strange group to those removed from the natural world, druids of the Circle of Scavengers are highly regarded among their earthen peers.

This supplement includes:

The Circle of Scavengers archetype.

boardgame.name: Fearless Creatures
boardgame.description:
A dice battle game between fearless creatures. Use action cards to play creatures from your hand, battle with any creatures that are in play, and draw cards.

Each creature's ability are described on the card. Roll battle dice. Collect victory tokens when you send creatures to the discard pile. The player with the most victory tokens wins.

A turn works like this: each player chooses an action card (draw cards, play cards, battle), and then actions are resolved in order (draw cards, battle, play cards).

Creatures roll the same # of dice as their strength ratings in the upper right, though the number of battle dice that are rolled may be modified by creature descriptions (both attacker and defender) or by other creature cards with the ability to interrupt a battle. Resolve the battle, and then collect victory tokens (if earned).

A battle works like this: a melee battle happens simultaneously, which means creatures on both sides get to roll before any damage is applied. Because damage is applied at the same time, both sides may win or lose a battle. Some creatures can ranged battle, which means they get to roll, but their opponent does not. Some creatures have first-strike ability, which means they get to apply battle damage before the defender rolls back.

All creatures have unique descriptions and capabilities. Lots of creatures have the ability to band together (as herds, swarms, pods, flocks, etc.) and when they are banded together they battle as a group. Damage to creatures that band together is still determined by a creature's individual strength. It is possible possible for a large group of creatures to cause a lot of damage, but also to take a lot of damage that is applied to more than one creature in the group.

Some cards (in expansion packs) represent places. The creatures in these places battle just like the named creature cards with the card strength representing both the creature's strength and the places strength. (Yes, you can also battle places!). Some places cards can generate groups of creatures, as described by the card.

Use the included white tokens to track victory points. Use the included colored tokens to track individual creature status, such as the number of creatures on a places card.

Fearless Creatures is supposed to be a lightweight, fun (yet kinda silly) battle game between creatures that might not always get a chance to battle in real life. It's also meant to be educational, as in "What is this creature?" or "Where is this place?" and then you can learn more about them. The game is best played in small groups of 2-4 people, ideally a family setting that spans generations.

No creatures were harmed while creating this game.

Fearless Creatures is a print-on-demand card game. You can order a copy here: https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/fearless-creatures.

boardgame.name: Political Mess
boardgame.description:
A politician-laying, vote-grabbing micro puzzle game designed by Daryl Chow.

In this rapid but surprisingly deep tile-laying area control game, players lay cards trying to control democracy monument, while strategically trying to place their politician in secure locations to protect their valuable rights. The player who controls the best and most monuments at the end of the game wins!

In this File, martial actions. Discover two new common basic actions that any character can use, Coup de Grace and Fight Defensively, as well as over ten new general feats that allow you to specialize in these actions. Using these rules, your player characters will be able to better defend themselves against critical hits, defeat wounded enemies with a single blow, and more!

boardgame.name: Burials of Teganshire (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Staying alive…
…will be the least of your troubles.
The road through Tegan’s Bridge is not safe anymore.
The small village of Teganhsire is in disarray as the workers sent to repair the bridge never came back to town, and rumors spread that a monster has killed them all. Hired PCs investigate the situation but find themselves thrown into a maelstrom of druidic intrigue and repercussions of an old feud between the village and forest spirits.

Burials of Teganshire is a module for level 1-3 characters the DM can use in any campaign setting (commercial or homebrew). It is the first module of the Circle of the Blood Moon adventure path that will take characters to level 10, through a long campaign filled with complex encounters and ancient mysteries.

A Challenging Campaign Setting Agnostic, Modular Adventure
We wanted to put modular back into the module. The Kingdom of Lothmar is our setting, and in the appendix of the module, we guide how to play this adventure in Lothmar. However, we designed it so that if you want to play the module in your campaign world, you totally can. How do we achieve that? First off, the action of the module is local; it spans an area of about 15 miles wide, that you can easily plug into your preferred setting. Also, we made sure to strip any lore or NPC behavior that would not apply to most game worlds, offering the possibility to play it as it is, or DMs to add their custom lore-specific content to their liking.

Heroic Content for Heroic PCs
We want players to feel like heroes. Our modules are challenging and complex because players do not like to feel their progression is undeserved. Nothing beats a party of players cheering at each other after a tough battle. We also believe that actions should have consequences, and our modules include many different possible endings based on how the players behaved. Motivated and plausible NPCs support compelling stories. Every important NPC has motivations and perspectives, giving DMs the tools to bring the environment to life.

Stuffed with Amazing Maps and High-Quality Goodness!
First, the maps: We’re pretty proud of them and excited to put them in your hands. We humbly think we have the best maps in the industry!

This module comes with maps-you-can-play-with. Our maps are no mere fancy illustrations for the book; they are immersive tools for players and DMs to use. The maps presented in the module are of small enough scale that, again, you can plug them into your world. We think of maps as story generators: when characters need to travel from one locale to another, a rich and detailed map turns that journey into an adventure.

Kandra Full Page Map by Anna Meyer
Kandra Overland Zoom Map by Anna Meyer
Teganshire Village Battle Map by Daniel Hasenbos
Tegan’s Bridge Battle Map by Daniel Hasenbos
The Grotto DM Battle Map by Daniel Hasenbos
The Grotto VTT Battle Map by Daniel Hasenbos
Burials of Teganshire is 30 pages with an easy to use layout, printed on 70lb paper using a premium color printing technique. Included is a free 16-page PDF of the Viscounty of Kandra Gazetteer. Buy today; you won’t be disappointed!

boardgame.name: Welcome to Sysifus Corp
boardgame.description:
The perfect "gateway" board game that will get your non-gamer friends addicted to the world of board games!

- You can teach the game in about 5 minutes—even to your non-gamer friends.
- Endlessly replayable with over 3.2 million setup combinations.
- Easy to learn, but hard to master with lots of depth in the gameplay. (So you won’t be bored)

Welcome to Sysifus Corp! You are EMPLOYEE#318996 and are part of the most recent cohort of new hires here at Sysifus Corp. Your goal at this company is to suck up to all three Bosses before attending your annual Performance Review. The first employee to do so will be promoted! But be careful as your fellow coworkers will do anything to make you fail.

Welcome to Sysifus Corp is a literal rat-race around the board as you build a path to the Bosses in their corner offices and return to the Performance Review tile.

Employees will build a collective path by placing Project cards around the board. They will then traverse this path, amassing Company Influence along the way, and utilize that Influence to play various Office Politics cards (25 unique cards). There is no limit on how far your career can go when you fully leverage the power of Office Politics.

In a typical turn:
- players create a path to the Bosses by placing Project cards
- players can block off paths so that others cannot follow, causing others to potentially get stuck
- use Office Politics cards to get ahead or sabotage your coworkers
- chain together multiple cards to achieve crazy combos such as swapping locations, causing others to get stuck, or shifting the entire office layout
- manage your Company Influence wisely and use them strategically to get even further ahead

When a player successfully visits all three Bosses and makes it back to the Performance Review tile, they are declared the winner and receive the coveted promotion!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Ao!!!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Ação!!!, o livro que você tem agora em mãos, é um jogo de interpretação conhecido mundialmente pela sigla RPG (Role Playing Game — Jogo de Interpretação de Personagens). Neste jogo, os participantes assumem papéis no intuito de contar histórias, como em uma espécie de teatro de improviso. Ao contrário dos videogames ou jogos de tabuleiro, tudo o que acontece em um RPG se desenvolve na imaginação dos jogadores. Então, o único limite para o que acontece em uma sessão de jogo é a criatividade dos jogadores e do Mestre.

User summary:

In the world of Ação!!! everything is bigger, more dangerous, and more exciting than real life - it's like living in a movie... and you are the star!
